jdraw.framework
Interface DrawView

public interface DrawView

The class DrawView displays a graphic model. It is responsible for the presentation of the model and the forwarding of the user interaction to its associated controller.

Version:
2.5
Author:
Dominik Gruntz & Christoph Denzler
See Also:
DrawModel, DrawContext, DrawTool

Method Detail

getModel

DrawModel getModel()
Returns the graphic model of this view.

Returns:
the graphic model presented by this view

setDrawContext

void setDrawContext(DrawContext controller)
Sets the controller to be used by this view.

Parameters:
controller - the controller to be used by this view

getDrawContext

DrawContext getDrawContext()
Returns the controller which was assigned to this view.

Returns:
the controller associated with this view

setConstrainer

void setConstrainer(PointConstrainer p)
Sets the current point constrainer. If the constrainer passes is null then a previously registered constrainer is removed.

Parameters:
p - point constrainer to be used

getConstrainer

PointConstrainer getConstrainer()
Gets the current grid setting.

Returns:
the current point constrainer

getHandle

FigureHandle getHandle(int x,
                       int y,
                       MouseEvent e)
Gets the handle (if any) that is at the mouse position. Although any information about the mouse's position is already contained in the MouseEvent e, a pair of coordinates is given to this procedure. x and y represent the constrained position of e.getX() and e.getY().

Parameters:
x - the constrained x-coordinate of the mouse.
y - the constrained y-coordinate of the mouse.
e - the mouse event
Returns:
the handle at the mouse position or null if no handle is selected.

getSelection

List<Figure> getSelection()
Returns a list which contains the currently selected figures. The figures are ordered in the order in which they were selected by the user. Changes applied to this list do not change the selection state of any figure. For changing the selection see methods addToSelection, removeFromSelction and clearSelection.

Returns:
list of selected figures

clearSelection

void clearSelection()
Clears the selection.

addToSelection

void addToSelection(Figure f)
Adds a figure to the selected figures. The figure is added at the end of the list of selected figures.

Parameters:
f - the figure to add to the selection.

removeFromSelection

void removeFromSelection(Figure f)
Removes a figure from the selected figures.

Parameters:
f - the figure to remove from the selection.

setSelectionRubberBand

void setSelectionRubberBand(Rectangle rect)
Sets a selection rubber band to be displayed by the draw view. If the rect parameter passed is null then new rubber band is displayed.

Parameters:
rect - the selection rubber band rectangle.

paint

void paint(Graphics g)
Draws the graphic model. The paint method iterates over all figures in the graphic model and calls their paint method.

Parameters:
g - the graphics context to use when painting.

repaint

void repaint()
Repaints this view.

setCursor

void setCursor(Cursor c)
Sets the cursor of the DrawingView.

Parameters:
c - the cursor to set.

close

void close()
Close is called when the window is closed. Should be used to remove resources, e.g. registered listeners.
